channel.title: A Potentially Serious Question
channel.description: Ok, well this Christmas and my birthday, I'm asking for only money. No games, no nerf guns (lol ^-^), and not even napster/itune cards. I'm hoping to get $400+ in total. So if I get that much, what should I get? A new desktop computer, or an XBox 360? I would want the computer because mine right now (Dell Inspiron 1300) is a laptop with a useless battery, and is maybe 2-3 years old now. It has to be plugged in all the times, and even if you unplug it for not even a second it dies. I would want an XBox 360 because just about everyone I know has one, and I seriously want some of the games on it. :P Well what do you all think, desktop or XBox? Oh yea, if I got a desktop, it would only be the computer itself. I already have a monitor, mouse, and keyboard.

item.title: A Potentially Serious Question
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

Explisionist:

Get the xbox 360, the computer is a complete waste.

rolf buy a ps3 slim thats a computer + gameconsole in one better then those crap xboxes i have them both home , but ps3 is becomming mutch moderner then xbox 360. ect. wireless internet free internet smaller , uses less power , blue ray player. better grafics … well no fan.

Read full topic

@lesterknome wrote:

lol’d. i had this exact desicion and i though “i have a computer, but not a xbox” so i went with xbox. and i am glad i did.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2009, 09:46:48 pm[/size][hr]on phone sorry for misspelled wrods

item.title: A Potentially Serious Question
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Yes, I have many friends with live but I horridly suck at cod.
And Lin, I’m only saying 400 because I’m sure I will get that overall. If absolutely everyone gives me money instead of gifts (including “Santa”), I should get a total more so around $650-$750.

Read full topic

item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Primadude:

Get xbox 360 and cod4/5; you will not be able to get off it.

this, but it’s only fun if you have friends to play with

item.title: A Potentially Serious Question
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Desktop, because you can do much more with a computer than a game system (Did that even make sense?)…

And also, I don’t think you can get a really nice computer with only $400. If I were you, I’d just max out your ram, get the best video card you can, a fairly big hdd, and a sexy monitor.

Read full topic

item.title: A Potentially Serious Question
item.dc:creator: @Zillionair1 Zillionair1
item.description:
@Zillionair1 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:1, topic:298475”]Ok, well this Christmas and my birthday, I’m asking for only money. No games, no nerf guns (lol ^-^), and not even napster/itune cards. I’m hoping to get $400+ in total. So if I get that much, what should I get? A new desktop computer, or an XBox 360? I would want the computer because mine right now (Dell Inspiron 1300) is a laptop with a useless battery, and is maybe 2-3 years old now. It has to be plugged in all the times, and even if you unplug it for not even a second it dies. I would want an XBox 360 because just about everyone I know has one, and I seriously want some of the games on it. Well what do you all think, desktop or XBox? Oh yea, if I got a desktop, it would only be the computer itself. I already have a monitor, mouse, and keyboard.[/quote]Desktop. The 360 just plays games, sends messages, and you have to pay a monthly fee for Live.
